title: Bug 7752: Export multiple files with same file name under different directories to zip file fails
description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch WSWB and create two projects
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as 'foo.txt')
3. From the main menu, select File > Export and select Zip File to export
4. In the 'Export' dialog window, select both projects created earlier, give the zip file a name (such as 'test.zip'), and begin export to zip file.
OB: Exporting multiple files with the same name under different directories to a zip file fails. In the 'Export' dialog window, when selecting both projects and attempting to export to a zip file, an error message box pops up indicating that problems were encountered during export. The details of the error message specifically mention the file with the same name in project2 as the issue.
EB: The export operation should successfully create a zip file containing all the selected projects, even if they have files with the same name under different directories.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Launch WSWB and create two projects
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as 'foo.txt')
3. From the main menu, select File > Export and select Zip File to export
4. In the 'Export' dialog window, select both projects created earlier, give the zip file a name (such as 'test.zip'), and begin export to zip file. Ensure that an error message pops up during the export process.
